it.polimi.se2019.card.cardscript

Class LogicExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.card.cardscript.LogicExpression

  • public class LogicExpression
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the logic expression to filter players/blocks

      • LogicExpression

        public LogicExpression(java.lang.String expression)
        Constructs a new LogicExpression
        Parameters:
        expression - is the specific string that defines the logic expression
        Throws:
        CardScriptErrorException - when the expression is not well formed

    • Method Detail

      • checkBrackets

        private void checkBrackets()
        It checks if the logic expression is well-parenthesized. Return a boolean value based on the result of the check

      • containsSubExpression

        private boolean containsSubExpression()

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(Executor executor,
                        java.lang.Object object)
                 throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        Receives a player/a block
        Parameters:
        executor - is the executor of the command
        object - refers to a player or a block
        Returns:
        true if it is valid according to the expression
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • evaluateAndElements

        private boolean evaluateAndElements(java.lang.String[] andElements,
                                    java.lang.Object object)
                             throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        Evalutes the AND parts of the logic expression
        Parameters:
        andElements - are the AND elements of the logic expression
        object - is the player/block to be evaluated
        Returns:
        true if all AND elements return true
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • evaluateElement

        private boolean evaluateElement(java.lang.String element,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
                         throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        For each element, it checks if it is a negative(not)expression, if it is a sub-expression and then it executes all the possible command of the logic expression and evalutes the block or the player of that specific command of the command expression
        Parameters:
        element - is the element of the logic expression
        obj - is the player/block to be evaluated
        Returns:
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • evaluateOrElements

        private boolean evaluateOrElements(java.lang.String[] orElements,
                                   java.lang.Object object)
                            throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        Evaluetes the OR parts of the logic expression
        Parameters:
        orElements - are the OR elements of the logic expression
        object - is the player/block to be evaluated
        Returns:
        true if one OR element return true
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • extractSubExpressions

        private void extractSubExpressions()
        deletes the subexpression from the string of the logic expression

      • filter

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> filter(java.util.List<T> list,
                                           LogicExpression logicExpression,
                                           Executor executor)
        Filters the list using the logic expression passed as the parameter
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the list
        Parameters:
        list - is the list that has to be filtered
        logicExpression - is the logic expression used to filter the list
        executor - executes the command
        Returns:
        the filtered list

        private Block getBlockFromVariable(java.lang.String varName)
                            throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        receives the name of a variable already defined and returns the block that is associated to that variable(contained in the executor)
        Parameters:
        varName - is the name of the variable
        Returns:
        the block associated to that variable
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • isAtDistance

        private boolean isAtDistance(Block block1,
                             Block block2,
                             java.lang.String distance,
                             int maxOrMin)
                      throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        Check the distance between two blocks.
        Parameters:
        block1 - is the first block to evaluate
        block2 - is the second block for calculate the distance
        distance - is the value of the calculated distance between the blocks
        maxOrMin - is a boolean value which indicates if the distance between the two block is the maximum (or minimum) distance
        Returns:
        true if the distance is greater or equal max.distance or min.distance
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • isBlock

        private boolean isBlock(java.lang.String varName)
        Parameters:
        varName -
        Returns:
        true if the executor contains the block associated to that varname

      • isDigit

        private boolean isDigit(java.lang.String str)
        check the composition of the string
        Parameters:
        str - is the string to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the string consists of characters between 0 and 9

      • isInDirection

        private boolean isInDirection(Block block,
                              java.lang.String direction)
                       throws LogicExpressionEvaluationException
        checks if the the direction of the block is in the same direction compared to the context player's block
        Parameters:
        block - the block on which to evaluate the direction
        direction - direction to be evaluated
        Returns:
        true if the block is in the same direction compared to the context player's block
        Throws:
        LogicExpressionEvaluationException

      • isInSameDirectionOf

        private boolean isInSameDirectionOf(Block block1,
                                    Block block2)
        checks if the direction from a block is the same direction of another block.
        Parameters:
        block1 - is the first block to evaluate
        block2 - is the second block to evaluate
        Returns:

      • isInSameRoomOf

        private boolean isInSameRoomOf(Block block1,
                               Block block2)
        checks if two specific blocks are in the same room
        Parameters:
        block1 - is the first block to evaluate. If null, return false
        block2 - is the second block to evaluate.
        Returns:
        true if the block1's room is the same of block2's room

      • isInStraightLine

        private boolean isInStraightLine(Block block)
        checks if the block is on a straight line from the context player's block
        Parameters:
        block - is the block to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the block is on a straight line from the context player's block

      • isPlayer

        private boolean isPlayer(java.lang.String varName)
        Parameters:
        varName -
        Returns:
        true if the executor contains the player associated to that varname

      • isVisibleBy

        private boolean isVisibleBy(Player player,
                            Player p1,
                            Block b1)
        return a boolean value based on the visibility of a player (p1) or a block (b1) from a (context)player
        Parameters:
        player - is the player on which to check visibility. If null, return false
        p1 - is the player on which to check if it visible by the Player (context), if null, get the block.
        b1 - is the block on which to check if it visible by the specific player
        Returns:
        a boolean value based on the result of the check( true if player/block is visible by the specific player)
